luine (pl. luini) is a Quenya word meani: The word occurred mainly in Exilic Quenya Quenya; the Vanyar in their Vanyarin used ulban for blue
*Vardo tellumar nu luini "beneath the blue vaults of Varda" (Namárië)

p. 66: J.R.R. Tolkien experimented with luine being a cognate of Sindarin duin ("river")
column3: but noted that luine as meaning "river" was not used. Patrick H. Wynne has suggested that  luine meaning "river" perhaps only survived in compounds as -duinë (cf. Nunduinë#Etymology).
